description.narrative: The project aims at strengthening budget openness and transparency in general, and in the mineral sector in particular, through theimplementation of POBI and MOBI assessments and community participation in monitoring the use of revenues and expendituresfrom mining. Capacity building for the community and requiring regulatory agencies to take accountability: BTAP will work together with otherorganizations to raise awareness and capacity for poor communities, ethnic minorities and the underprivileged. Motivate them to incorporate their needs, proposals, opinions in development programs and require regulatory agencies to take accountability in a good, inclusive, and favorable governance system. Participatory methods and strategies for mobilizing participation will be jointly proposed by local partner organizations and partners within the project framework. This actor will contribute to enhance budget transparency in the extractive industry in Vietnam. During this process, the project will build capacity on budget literacy for communities, especially focusing on the poor, the ethnic minorities and the disabled peoples in the areas which are affected by extractive industry. They are then mobilized to voice out and demand for better governance and fiscalmanagement of development programs in their areas. This project will also aim at governmental agencies and urge them to apply international standards into the national legal frameworks of budget management. Ranking based on Provincial and Ministerial Open Budget Index (POBI and MOBI) will be conducted and other ranking systems based on budget management related to extractive industry will be developed. Communities’s initiatives will also be supported. All of these voices and evidence will be sent to the policy makers via workshops and forums to contribute to meaningful dialogues on budget transparency.

participating-org.narrative: Center for Development and Integration (CDI) is Vietnamese non #governmental, non- profit organization working for the rights of the disadvantaged groups to build a society of equity, solidarity and sustainable development. Vision The Center for Development and Integration aims at socio-economic development and good governance to build a society where the poor, women, men and children are respected and treated fairly in the context of rapid economic integration in Vietnam and Asia. Mission To make acontribution to narrowing the social gaps and finding solutions to the emerging issues of the society through supporting activities, advocacy and capacitybuilding. Goal (2015-2020) To be a capable and prestigious civil society organizaton that aims towards equitable and sustainable development and shared prosperity through activities to promote and ensure the rights of disadvantaged groups. Priorities themes Good Governance Labor rights Inclusive Growth Regarding Good Governance theme, CDI bringsmore than 8 years of experience working in participatory planning and budget transparency, accountability and people#s participation (BTAP) in Vietnam. CDI is responsible for carrying out the Open Budget Survey in Vietnam every two years and working on monthly online budget tracker for Vietnam. Joining the international network on budget transparency given CDI the many chances to exchange, shared learning and capacity building on budget transparency and accountability, especially citizen budget tool. CDIis a member of Budget Transparency Coalition of Vietnam CSOs advocating for State budget law amendment towards Transparency, Accountability and People Participation; an active member of CSO#s workinggroup advocating Vietnam Government joining Open Government Partnership. CDI also has significant local experiences across provinces in Vietnam, having carried out social audits, budget monitoring, participatory budget and planning, promoting people participationin development process, capacity building forlocal partners and developed working relationships with local institutions and actors. CDI has been collaborating with Irish Aid, EC, Oxfam, AFAP, CBPP (Center on Budget and Policy Priorities), etc for the work on BTAPin Vietnam.
